revised_title: Stability Analysis of Self-Similar and Steady Flows Near Singularities
tldr: The authors study self-similar and steady flows near singularities in fluid dynamics, focusing on transonic flows in radiation-gas-dynamics. They use Kulikovskii and Slobodkina's method to analyze the stability of these flows and apply it to a self-similar flow behind a strong imploding shock. The study finds that all possible one-dimensional steady flows in radiation-gas-dynamics are locally stable near the sonic point.
